greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: After a(1)=0, numbers 0 .. bigomega(n)-1, followed by numbers 0 .. bigomega(n+1)-1, etc., where bigomega(n)=A001222(n) is the number of prime factors of n (with repetition).
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
example: Viewed as an irregular table, the sequence is constructed as:
[2] 0; (because bigomega(2)=1, we have here terms from 0 to 0)
[4] 0, 1; (as bigomega(4)=2, we have terms from 0 to 2-1)
[8] 0, 1, 2; (as bigomega(8)=3, we have terms from 0 to 3-1).
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, May 01 2014
